body_html:
@martinwicke I think your concern regarding the name of the operation is valid. I had difficulty coming up with a generic enough operation name and "shuffle" was the best I could come up with. Maybe "periodic_arrange" or "periodic_intersperse" may be better, but I'm open to suggestions.

Regarding what the operation actually does, it performs a generic version of the sub-pixel convolution found here (Figure 1). My version allows for analogous operations for tensors of arbitrary rank and and relaxes a few of the other restrictions. For instance, the operation can handle rearranging a tensor of shape [2,3,6] into a tensor of shape [6,6,1]. I do need to add more examples and tests. I'll devise more tests and examples.

In the mean time, I currently only perform asserts rather than actually throwing errors. Can you recommend a format for raising exceptions, etc. in TF?
